description: This is a prototype dashboard for Constellation node operators, based on the Rocket Pool dashboard.

panels.description: A count of how long your Beacon Node has been running. If you don't restart it, this is about the same as your total system uptime.
panels.title: Beacon Node Uptime

panels.description:
The temperature of your CPU (you can set this to Tctl or Tdie, whichever you prefer to monitor).

To get the correct chip and sensor ID, you'll want to run `sensors` from the `lm-sensors` package. The Rocket Pool setup guide has more information on this process: see https://docs.rocketpool.net/guides/node/grafana.html for more information.
panels.title: CPU Temp

panels.description:
(Feature not ready yet)

This will turn red when your system needs to be rebooted because of security updates.
panels.title: Reboot Needed?

panels.description:
(Feature not ready yet)

Tracks any updates that are available for your OS or for Hyperdrive but haven't been applied yet. When one of these numbers is higher than 0, it means you should update your system or Hyperdrive accordingly.
panels.title: Available Updates

panels.description: How much of your total swap space you're currently using. If you have swap space enabled, you want this to be as low as possible - otherwise, your system is running out of free RAM.
panels.title: Swap Space Usage

panels.description: Tracks the activity of all of your validators on the Beacon Chain. This is a cumulative count; it starts at 0 when your node first starts up, and then continuously increments as it goes.

targets.expr:
sum(vc_signed_attestations_total{job="cs_vc", status="success"}) OR # Lighthouse
sum(vc_published_attestations_total{job="cs_vc"}) OR # Lodestar
sum(beacon_attestations_sent_total{job="cs_vc"}) OR # Nimbus
sum(validator_successful_attestations{job="cs_vc"}) OR # Prysm
validator_duties_performed_total{job="cs_vc", type="attestation", result="success"} OR # Teku
on() vector(0)

sum(vc_signed_beacon_blocks_total{job="cs_vc", status="success"}) OR # Lighthouse
sum(vc_block_published_total{job="cs_vc"}) OR # Lodestar
sum(beacon_blocks_sent_total{job="cs_vc"}) OR # Nimbus
sum(validator_successful_proposals{job="cs_vc"}) OR # Prysm
validator_duties_performed_total{job="cs_vc", type="block", result="success"} OR # Teku
on() vector(0)

panels.title: Validator Activity

panels.description: Tracks the activity of all of your validators on the Beacon Chain.

targets.expr:
(sum(rate(vc_signed_beacon_blocks_total{job="cs_vc", status="success"}[$__rate_interval])) OR # Lighthouse
sum(rate(vc_block_published_total{job="cs_vc"}[$__rate_interval])) OR # Lodestar
sum(rate(beacon_blocks_sent_total{job="cs_vc"}[$__rate_interval])) OR # Nimbus
sum(rate(validator_successful_proposals{job="cs_vc"}[$__rate_interval])) OR # Prysm
rate(validator_duties_performed_total{job="cs_vc", type="block", result="success"}[$__rate_interval]) OR # Teku
on() vector(0)) * 45

(sum(rate(vc_signed_attestations_total{job="cs_vc", status="success"}[$__rate_interval])) OR # Lighthouse
sum(rate(vc_published_attestations_total{job="cs_vc"}[$__rate_interval])) OR # Lodestar
sum(rate(beacon_attestations_sent_total{job="cs_vc"}[$__rate_interval])) OR # Nimbus
sum(rate(validator_successful_attestations{job="cs_vc"}[$__rate_interval])) OR # Prysm
rate(validator_duties_performed_total{job="cs_vc", type="attestation", result="success"}[$__rate_interval]) OR # Teku
on() vector(0)) * 45

panels.title: Validator Activity

panels.description: The CPU usage of your Execution Client and Beacon Node + Validator Client pair, as well as your system total (with respect to all cores on your CPU).

targets.expr:
(system_cpu_procload{job="geth"} / scalar(count without(cpu, mode) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"}))) OR # Geth
irate(process_cpu_seconds_total{job="ec"}[$__rate_interval]) * 100 / scalar(count without(cpu, mode) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"})) OR # Besu, Nethermind
irate(reth_process_cpu_seconds_total{job="ec"}[$__rate_interval]) * 100 / scalar(count without(cpu, mode) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"})) # Reth

panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: The amount of RAM that your Execution Client, Beacon Node and Validator Client combo, and your whole system are using.

targets.expr:
system_memory_used{job="geth"} OR # Geth
process_resident_memory_bytes{job="ec"} OR # Besu
process_working_set_bytes{job="ec"} OR # Nethermind
reth_process_resident_memory_bytes{job="ec"} # Reth

panels.title: RAM Usage

panels.description: The number of block proposals you have coming up in the next few minutes. If you were planning on taking your node down for maintenance, you should wait until after the proposals because they're worth a lot of ETH!
panels.title: Upcoming Proposals

panels.description:
The number of [sync committees](https://blockdaemon.com/blog/ethereum-altair-hard-folk-light-clients-sync-committees/) that you're about to be a part of, and that you're currently a part of.

If you were planning on doing maintenance to your node, **you should wait until the sync committee is over**. Not only are they worth an **extremely** large amount of ETH, but if you miss attestations during a sync committee, you **lose an extremely large amount of ETH** instead!

You should be online as long as possible while you are in a sync committee.
panels.title: Sync Committees

panels.description:
This chart shows the overall performance of your total attestations on the Beacon Chain, broken down by the individual attestation components - correct head, correct source, and correct target. If any of these are below 100%, you lost some rewards for submitting a late, partially incorrect, or fully incorrect attestation. For a detailed explanation of each component, take a look at Ben Edgington's explainer: https://eth2book.info/bellatrix/annotated-spec/

This is updated once per epoch, once your Beacon Node can see how well your node did during the previous epoch.

NOTE: **Lighthouse** and **Teku** currently do not provide source correctness information, only head and target.

targets.expr:
(irate(validator_monitor_prev_epoch_on_chain_target_attester_hit{job="bn", validator="total"}[$__rate_interval]) / (irate(validator_monitor_prev_epoch_on_chain_target_attester_hit{job="bn", validator="total"}[$__rate_interval]) + irate(validator_monitor_prev_epoch_on_chain_target_attester_miss{job="bn", validator="total"}[$__rate_interval]))) OR # Lighthouse
(irate(validator_monitor_prev_epoch_on_chain_target_attester_hit_total{job="bn"}[$__rate_interval]) / (irate(validator_monitor_prev_epoch_on_chain_target_attester_hit_total{job="bn"}[$__rate_interval]) + irate(validator_monitor_prev_epoch_on_chain_target_attester_miss_total{job="bn"}[$__rate_interval]))) OR # Nimbus and Lodestar
(sum(validator_correctly_voted_target{job="cs_vc"}) / count(validator_correctly_voted_target{job="cs_vc"})) OR # Prysm
(validator_performance_correct_target_count{job="bn"} / validator_performance_expected_attestations{job="bn"}) # Teku

irate(validator_monitor_prev_epoch_on_chain_head_attester_hit{job="bn", validator="total"}[$__rate_interval]) / (irate(validator_monitor_prev_epoch_on_chain_head_attester_hit{job="bn", validator="total"}[$__rate_interval]) + irate(validator_monitor_prev_epoch_on_chain_head_attester_miss{job="bn", validator="total"}[$__rate_interval])) OR # Lighthouse
irate(validator_monitor_prev_epoch_on_chain_head_attester_hit_total{job="bn"}[$__rate_interval]) / (irate(validator_monitor_prev_epoch_on_chain_head_attester_hit_total{job="bn"}[$__rate_interval]) + irate(validator_monitor_prev_epoch_on_chain_head_attester_miss_total{job="bn"}[$__rate_interval])) OR # Nimbus and Lodestar
(sum(validator_correctly_voted_head{job="cs_vc"}) / count(validator_correctly_voted_head{job="cs_vc"})) OR # Prysm
(validator_performance_correct_head_block_count{job="bn"} / validator_performance_expected_attestations{job="bn"}) # Teku

panels.title: Attestation Accuracy

panels.description:
Tracks the amount of CPU consumption for the Execution Client, the Beacon Node, and the total system. 100% means all of your CPU core are being used at their full capacity. The orange line indicates how much CPU a single core can provide in your system.

**Note:** The EC's usage is stacked *on top of* the BN+VC, so it shows the aggregated amount of EC + BN + VC.

targets.expr:
(system_cpu_procload{job="geth"} / scalar(count without(cpu, mode) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"}))) OR # Geth
irate(process_cpu_seconds_total{job="ec"}[$__rate_interval]) * 100 / scalar(count without(cpu, mode) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"})) OR # Besu, Nethermind
irate(reth_process_cpu_seconds_total{job="ec"}[$__rate_interval]) * 100 / scalar(count without(cpu, mode) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"})) # Reth

panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description:
Tracks the total amount of RAM usage by the eth2 client and the entire system, versus how much is available.

**Note:** The EC's usage is stacked *on top of* the BN+VC, so it shows the aggregated amount of EC + BN + VC.

targets.expr:
system_memory_used{job="geth"} OR # Geth
process_resident_memory_bytes{job="ec"} OR # Besu
process_working_set_bytes{job="ec"} OR # Nethermind
reth_process_resident_memory_bytes{job="ec"} # Reth

panels.title: RAM Usage

panels.description:
This tells you when your next attestation duty will arrive. Use it to find an optimal time to take your clients down for maintenance so you're back up and running before it hits.

- NOTE: **Lodestar** and **Teku** do not provide this information.

targets.expr:
((min(vc_attestation_duty_slot{job="cs_vc"}) - scalar(beacon_head_slot{job="bn"})) * 12) OR # Lighthouse
max(next_action_wait{job="bn"} OR # Nimbus
(min((validator_next_attestation_slot{job="cs_vc"} - scalar(beacon_slot{job="bn"})) > 0 - 1) * 12) OR # Prysm
on() vector(0))

panels.title: Next Attestation

panels.description: How many validator keys are currently loaded by your Validator Client.

targets.expr:
vc_signers_count{job="cs_vc"} OR # Lodestar
vc_validators_total_count{job="cs_vc"} OR # Lighthouse
validators{job="cs_vc"} OR # Nimbus 
count(validator_statuses{job="cs_vc"}) OR # Prysm
validator_local_validator_count{job="cs_vc"} # Teku

panels.title: VC Keys Loaded

panels.description: How many peers your EC is currently connected to.

targets.expr:
p2p_peers{job="geth"} OR # Geth
ethereum_peer_count{job="ec"} OR # Nethermind, Besu
reth_network_connected_peers{job="ec"} # Reth

panels.title: EC Peers

panels.description: How many peers your Beacon Node is currently connected to on the Beacon Chain.

targets.expr:
sum(sync_peers_per_status{job="bn", sync_status=~"Synced|Advanced"}) OR # Lighthouse
lodestar_peers_sync_count{job="bn"} OR # Lodestar
nbc_peers{job="bn"} OR # Nimbus
p2p_peer_count{job="bn", state="Connected"} OR # Prysm
beacon_peer_count{job="bn"} # Teku

panels.title: BN Peers

panels.description: How many peers Execution Client and Beacon Node are currently connected to for blockchain traffic.

targets.expr:
sum(sync_peers_per_status{job="bn", sync_status=~"Synced|Advanced"}) OR # Lighthouse
lodestar_peers_sync_count{job="bn"} OR # Lodestar
nbc_peers{job="bn"} OR # Nimbus
p2p_peer_count{job="bn", state="Connected"} OR # Prysm
beacon_peer_count{job="bn"} # Teku

p2p_peers{job="geth"} OR # Geth
ethereum_peer_count{job="ec"} OR # Nethermind, Besu
reth_network_connected_peers{job="ec"} # Reth

panels.title: Peers

panels.description: This tracks how long it takes between one of your processes trying to read from / write to your SSD, and when that operation is actually performed. Think of this like "how long SSD reads and writes have to wait in a queue before completing". The longer this time, the longer it takes for your node to perform its Beacon Chain duties.
panels.title: I/O Wait Time

panels.description:
The disk space used by your primary (Operating System) hard drive. Change the `device` option in this query to be your machine's hard drive.

Check Rocket Pool's guide for more information: see https://docs.rocketpool.net/guides/node/grafana.html.
panels.title: Disk Space Used

panels.description:
The temperature of your SSD.

To get the correct chip and sensor ID, you'll want to run `sensors` from the `lm-sensors` package. 

Check Rocket Pool's guide for more information: see https://docs.rocketpool.net/guides/node/grafana.html.
panels.title: Disk Temp

panels.description:
The average read/write latency of your SSD. The lower it is, the faster your machine can process and respond to Beacon Chain activities like attesting. Change the `device` setting in the queries to be the SSD you want to track (typically the one with your chain data on it).

Check Rocket Pool's guide for more information: see https://docs.rocketpool.net/guides/node/grafana.html.
panels.title: SSD Latency

panels.description:
A chart showing the network I/O used by your main network adapter over time. To make it work, change the `device` setting in the queries to match the name of the network adapter you want to track (you can use `ifconfig` to get a list of network adapters and find the right one). 

Check Rocket Pool's guide for more information: see https://docs.rocketpool.net/guides/node/grafana.html.
panels.title: Network Usage

panels.description:
The total network I/O that has gone through your main network adapter. To make it work, change the `device` setting in the queries to match the name of the network adapter you want to track (you can use `ifconfig` to get a list of network adapters and find the right one). 

Check Rocket Pool's guide for more information: see https://docs.rocketpool.net/guides/node/grafana.html.
panels.title: Total Net I/O

panels.description: The total ETH balance of all of your validators on the Beacon Chain. This is not your share of the balance; it includes rewards for Rocket Pool's rETH stakers and Constellation's xrETH stakers as well. It's more useful as a quick health check. As long as this number is going up, your validator is performing its duties.
panels.title: Beacon Balance

panels.description:
This is how much ETH is currently available for distribution in each of your minipool contracts (on the execution layer). 

Constellation handles minipool distribution automatically; you don't have to do this as a node operator. This is just shown purely for your own reference, and may be useful to track when rewards skimming occurs on the Beacon Chain.
panels.title: Minipool Balance (EL)

panels.description: The balance of your node wallet. Keep an eye on how much ETH you have; if it falls too low, your node won't be able to pay for gas during automatic transactions.
panels.title: Node Wallet Balance

title: Hyperdrive Dashboard for Constellation v0.1.0
